revised_title: Morphological Studies of Spore-Producing Members: Equisetine and Lycopodine
tldr: The author examines the morphology of spore-producing members in Equisetine and Lycopodine, discussing the development of the sporophyte and the importance of spore production in the evolution of vascular plants. The study emphasizes the need for a comparative and developmental approach to understanding the morphology of spore-producing organs and their significance in plant evolution.
